text: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous mind
author: Johnson, Samuel

text: Commonplace minds usually condemn what is beyond the reach of their understanding
author: La Rochefoucauld

text: Modesty may make a fool seem a man of sense
author: Swift

text: An appeal to the reason of the people has never been known to fail in the long run
author: Lowell

text: Man is a reasoning rather than a reasonable animal
author: Hamilton

text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying
author: Frost

text: An empty head serves as an excellent container for other's thoughts
author: Anonymous

text: The fundamental cause of trouble in the world is that the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doub
author: Russell

text: He who thinks little, errs much
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind
author: Jeffrey Eugenides, Middlesex

text: I am a brain, Watson. The rest of me is a mere appendix
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Adventure of the Mazarin Stone

text: Life is funny that way. Sometimes the dumbest thing you do turns out to be the smartest
author: Robyn Mundell, Brainwalker

text: A man should keep his little brain attic stocked with all the furniture that he is likely to use, and the rest he can put away in the lumber room of his library, where he can get it if he wants it
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

text: Your own brain ought to have the decency to be on your side!
author: Terry Pratchett, Wintersmith
